title: Riot, why are you still overcharging for old "legendary" skins?
body:
Two years ago, you established [guidelines for skin prices.](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/content/skin-rp-price-changes) At the time, several old legendary skins did not belong in the 1820 tier, most of them not even belonging in the 1350 tier. I brought this up on the old boards, and m[y thread](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=3389697) received over 300 upvotes, 26 pages of discussion, and not a SINGLE Rioter jumped in the discussion. 

Nothing has changed since. Riot has not addressed this in any way, shape, or form, none of the old legendaries have received updates to make them into what their price point requires, and they continue to be sold in the shop as is. That's not right.

You owe your players and paying customers more than this. Please speak up.

replies.body: As long as people continue to pay legendary prices for lackluster skins, Riot has no incentive whatsoever to change the pricing structure. Quite the opposite, in fact. Once people stop buying said skins, they'll consider adjusting the cost.

Additionally, the problem is that they need to refund people whenever the skin changes in price (even if it's temporarily put on sale). I think this is a defining factor in Riot's choice to be mute over it.
